importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of publication indicates the timing of the incident and public disclosure of Doug Martin's death, highlighting a current event in sports and public safety.

The date marks when the Oakland Police Department and local officials publicly released details about the circumstances of Doug Martin’s death, signaling a moment of public accountability and community response.
The date reflects when the media and public first learned of the incident, underscoring the immediate impact of mental health and law enforcement interactions in a high-profile case.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline shows that Martin was arrested early Saturday, leading to his death on 2025-10-20, indicating a critical period where mental health deterioration intersected with a law enforcement encounter.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back, died after being taken into custody during a break-in investigation in Oakland, California.
Martin was involved in a break-in at a home in Oakland and reportedly had a brief struggle with police.
His former agent, Brian Murphy, stated that Martin had long-standing mental health challenges that significantly affected his personal and professional life.
Martin felt overwhelmed and disoriented, fled his home, and entered a neighbor’s home where police found him.
Martin was the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL draft and had a successful career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including multiple Pro Bowl and All-Pro selections.
He is recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history.
The death has prompted investigations by multiple agencies, including Oakland Police, city police commission, community police review agency, and county district attorney’s office.
The incident raises broader concerns about mental health support, de-escalation in law enforcement, and the treatment of individuals in crisis during custodial situations.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back from the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after being taken into custody by Oakland Police during a break-in investigation. The incident began when Martin, who had long struggled with mental health issues, fled his home and entered a neighbor’s house. Police responded, and he became unresponsive, leading to his death at a hospital. The case has prompted investigations by multiple agencies, including Oakland Police, the city’s police commission, and the county district attorney’s office. Martin’s former agent, Brian Murphy, revealed that Martin’s mental health challenges significantly impacted his life, and the incident raises serious questions about the handling of individuals in crisis during law enforcement interactions. As a local figure with deep roots in Oakland, Martin’s death has prompted community mourning and calls for improved mental health support and de-escalation practices in policing.
title: Former NFL Star Doug Martin Dies After Being Taken Into Custody in Oakland Break-In Investigation
